title: Guaranteed Income Better Than Bigger CTC
sub_head: A guaranteed income is preferable to a UBI or CTC in that it goes only to those who need it.
body:
Regarding Greg Ip’s column “Capital Account: Child Tax Credit vs. Universal Basic Income” (U.S. News, Feb. 18): An option not discussed is guaranteed income, a payment targeted to the poor and middle class. It is preferable to a UBI or CTC in that it goes only to those who need it. And it addresses the fact that not all families include children, but all deserve financial stability.
Guaranteed income recognizes that no child should live in poverty; and it goes beyond that to also say that no American deserves to live in poverty. We are the wealthiest country in the world, and it is a global embarrassment that we allow millions of children and adults to go hungry or without a roof over their heads. A guaranteed income is the most direct and efficient way to rid America of the pandemic of poverty.
Michael Tubbs
Stockton, Calif.
Mr. Tubbs is the founder of Mayors for a Guaranteed Income and a former mayor of Stockton, Calif.
